text.35_Daf, 41_Line: R. Jeremiah b. Eleazar further stated:
text.35_Daf, 43_Line: And lo in her mouth an olive-leaf freshly plucked?  The dove said to the Holy One, blessed be He,
text.35_Daf, 19_Line: Or in the case of Elisha,
text.35_Daf, 48_Line: But none saith: ‘Where is God my Maker who giveth songs in the night’.
text.35_Daf, 20_Line: since it is written in Scripture: And he arose, and followed her, was he also an ignorant man?
text.35_Daf, 34_Line: Adam was a great saint. When he saw that through him death was ordained as a punishment he spent a hundred and thirty years in fasting, severed connection with his wife for a hundred and thirty years, and wore clothes of fig [leaves] on his body for a hundred and thirty years. —
text.35_Daf, 36_Line: R. Jeremiah b. Eleazar further stated:
text.35_Daf, 1_Line: ‘And brought her to Adam’ teaches that the Holy One, blessed be He, acted as groomsman for the first man. From here [you may infer] that a great man should act as groomsman for a minor person and feel no regrets about it.
text.35_Daf, 22_Line: ‘after her words and her counsel’ so here also [could it not be explained:]
text.35_Daf, 49_Line: R. Jeremiah b. Eleazar further stated:
text.35_Daf, 31_Line: In all those years  during which Adam  was under the ban he begot ghosts and male demons and female demons, for it is said in Scripture:
text.35_Daf, 14_Line: Manoah was an ignorant man, since it is said:
text.35_Daf, 30_Line: R. Jeremiah b. Eleazar further stated:
text.35_Daf, 40_Line: Noah was in his generations a man righteous and wholehearted.
text.35_Daf, 10_Line: A man who counts out money for a woman from his hand into hers or from her hand into his, in order that he might look at her, will not be free from the judgment of Gehenna even if he is [in other respects] like our Master Moses who received the law at Mount Sinai;
text.35_Daf, 32_Line: And Adam lived a hundred and thirty years and begot a son in his own likeness, after his own image, from which it follows that until that time he did not beget after his own image.
text.35_Daf, 0_Line: of a storehouse. As a storehouse is [made] wide below and narrow above so that it may contain the produce, so was [the womb of] a woman [made] wide below and narrow above so that it may contain the embryo.
text.35_Daf, 33_Line: An objection was raised: R. Meir said:
text.35_Daf, 27_Line: And Rebekah arose, and her damsels, and they rode upon the camels, and followed the man, but they did not precede the man.
text.35_Daf, 51_Line: Let every thing that hath breath praise the Lord, praise ye the Lord.
text.35_Daf, 55_Line: I will also make it a possession for the bittern, and pools of water;
text.35_Daf, 7_Line: If she happened [to be in front of] him on a bridge he should leave her on one side;
text.35_Daf, 18_Line: ‘And Elkanah went after his wife’, was he also [an ignorant man]?
text.35_Daf, 39_Line: For thee have I seen righteous before Me in this generation; ‘but all of it in his absence’, for it is written in Scripture:
text.35_Daf, 50_Line: Since the Sanctuary was destroyed it is enough for the world to use only two letters [of the Tetragrammaton],  for it is said in Scripture:
text.35_Daf, 56_Line: ‘but when Samaria was cursed her neighbours were blessed’, for it is written:
text.35_Daf, 8_Line: and whosoever crosses a river behind a [married] woman has no share in the world to come.
text.35_Daf, 2_Line: With reference to the view of him who explained: ‘A full face’ which of them walked first? —
text.35_Daf, 15_Line: And Manoah arose, and went after his wife.
text.35_Daf, 37_Line: Only a part of a man's praise may be said in his presence, but all of it in his absence.
text.35_Daf, 29_Line: [Let one walk] behind a lion but not behind a [married] woman; behind a [married] woman but not behind an idol, behind an idol but not behind a synagogue at the time the congregation is praying.
text.35_Daf, 17_Line: Now then, since in the case of Elkanah it is written
text.35_Daf, 44_Line: ‘May my food be as bitter as the olive but entrusted to your hand rather than sweet as honey and dependent on a mortal’;
text.35_Daf, 45_Line: for here it is written ‘freshly plucked’ and elsewhere it is written: Feed me with mine allotted bread.
text.35_Daf, 35_Line: That statement was made in reference to the semen which he emitted accidentally.
text.35_Daf, 38_Line: ‘Only a part of a man's praise . . . in his presence’, for it is written in Scripture:
text.35_Daf, 52_Line: R. Jeremiah b. Eleazar further stated:
text.35_Daf, 53_Line: When Babylon was cursed, her neighbours also were cursed,  but when Samaria was cursed her neighbours were blessed.
text.35_Daf, 25_Line: On R. Nahman's assumption that Manoah was an ignorant man, he did not attend even a school for Scripture,
text.35_Daf, 47_Line: Any house in which the words of the Torah are heard at night will never be destroyed; for it is said in Scripture:
text.35_Daf, 6_Line: No man should walk on a road behind a woman, even if she is his own wife.
text.35_Daf, 54_Line: ‘When Babylon was cursed her neighbours also were cursed’, for it is written:
text.35_Daf, 46_Line: R. Jeremiah b. Eleazar further stated:
text.35_Daf, 12_Line: Hand to hand, he will not be free from evil [which means,] he will not be free from the judgment of Gehenna.
text.35_Daf, 57_Line: Therefore I will make Samaria a heap in the field,
text.35_Daf, 4_Line: It is reasonable to assume that the male walked first;
text.35_Daf, 42_Line: What [was signified] when it was written:
